channel.title: How do i make npcs talk?
channel.description: how? ive added the propper cases nd shit for it but when i talk to the npc, it only speaks one of the cases, not all of them :/

item.title: How do i make npcs talk?
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

omfg THANK U SO MUCH!!! :DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDd
theres only one problem. when i speak to santa, after he finishes speakin to automaticly goes staright to the gnome talking, then after that it goes straight to santas chat

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make npcs talk?

item.title: How do i make npcs talk?
item.dc:creator: @jailed jailed
item.description:
@jailed wrote:

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:8, topic:369959”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=466078.msg3409290#msg3409290 date=1290551834]

thanks heaps!!! it works :):):)
i would rep u but for some reason im only 5 rep.
also, ive made an xmas event on it, you talk to santa, he tells u to get his sled back, santa teleports u to the gnome that has the sled, and he gives u the sled… how do i make it:
gnome stops giving you sled after you have one, and
how to make santa say thanks when you have the sled.
[/quote]Use an integer.

Such as;

//method for talking to gnome
if (integer == 0) {
    //addSledHere;
    integer = 1;
} else {
    sM("You already got a sled!");
}

Sorry, I haven’t used Delta in a while, but that would be the setup.

Thanks, so what would i have to type in for npc 66 and where would i put it?[/quote]

you can declare a new save in the character file ;D
im not sure if you did it before, but ill make a lil tut for it:

in player.java:

under:

public abstract class Player implements Constants {

add:

public int xmas;

in client.java
search for:

} else if (token.equals("character-donator")) {

under the last ‘;’ add:

} else if (token.equals("character-xmas")) { xmas = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then search for:

characterfile.write("character-donator = ", 0, 20);

under the last ‘characterfile.newLine();’ (under the donator code) add:

characterfile.write("character-xmas = ", 0, 17); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(xmas), 0, Integer.toString(xmas).length()); characterfile.newLine();

then replace the current method for talking to the gnome and santa:

if(NPCID == #### && xmas == 0){ //santa id NpcDialogue = ###; // npcdialogue when he first talks to santa NpcDialogueSend = false; xmas += 1; } if(NPCID == #### && xmas == 1){ //gnome id NpcDialogue = ###; // npcdialogue when he first talks to gnome, after he spoke to santa NpcDialogueSend = false; xmas += 1; addItem(####, 1); // sled id } if(NPCID == #### && xmas == 2 && playerHasItem(####, 1)){ //santa id & sled id NpcDialogue = ###; // npcdialogue when he talks to santa after he recieved the sled NpcDialogueSend = false; xmas += 1; } if(NPCID == #### && xmas == 3){ //santa id NpcDialogue = ###; // npcdialogue when he have gave the sled to santa(done with the event.. idk) NpcDialogueSend = false; xmas += 1; }

save, compile, restart… done
NOTE: i haven’t tested the npc methods, i just wrote them from scratch in here… if you recieve errors please tell me and i’ll corret them.

Read full topic

gnome stops giving you sled after you have one, and

item.title: How do i make npcs talk?
item.dc:creator: @jailed jailed
item.description:
@jailed wrote:

in client.java, search for: case 40:

you should see something like this:

if (NpcDialogue == 1 || NpcDialogue == 177 || NpcDialogue == 178 || NpcDialogue == 179 || NpcDialogue == 180 || NpcDialogue == 181 || NpcDialogue == 182 || NpcDialogue == 183 || NpcDialogue == 184 || NpcDialogue == 185 || NpcDialogue == 186 || NpcDialogue == 2|| NpcDialogue == 3 || NpcDialogue == 4 || NpcDialogue == 5 || NpcDialogue == 6 || NpcDialogue == 8 || NpcDialogue == 10 || NpcDialogue == 13 || NpcDialogue == 16 || NpcDialogue == 18 || NpcDialogue == 19 || NpcDialogue == 21 || NpcDialogue == 22 || NpcDialogue == 23 || NpcDialogue == 27 || NpcDialogue == 28 || NpcDialogue == 30 || NpcDialogue == 31 || NpcDialogue == 32 || NpcDialogue == 34 || NpcDialogue == 37 || NpcDialogue == 41 || NpcDialogue == 42 || NpcDialogue == 44 || NpcDialogue == 45 || NpcDialogue == 48 || NpcDialogue == 49 || NpcDialogue == 50 || NpcDialogue == 52 || NpcDialogue == 54 || NpcDialogue == 57 || NpcDialogue == 60 || NpcDialogue == 64 || NpcDialogue == 65 || NpcDialogue == 66 || NpcDialogue == 73 || NpcDialogue == 75 || NpcDialogue == 77 || NpcDialogue == 81 || NpcDialogue == 82 || NpcDialogue == 83 || NpcDialogue == 85 || NpcDialogue == 87 || NpcDialogue == 91 || NpcDialogue == 89 || NpcDialogue == 90 || NpcDialogue == 91 || NpcDialogue == 92 || NpcDialogue == 95 || NpcDialogue == 96 || NpcDialogue == 97 || NpcDialogue == 98 || NpcDialogue == 100 || NpcDialogue == 102 || NpcDialogue == 103 || NpcDialogue == 105 || NpcDialogue == 106 || NpcDialogue == 107 || NpcDialogue == 108 || NpcDialogue == 109 || NpcDialogue == 111 || NpcDialogue == 112 || NpcDialogue == 114 || NpcDialogue == 116) { NpcDialogue += 1; NpcDialogueSend = false; }

simply, add your first NpcDialogue here. that means when you click to continue it passes on to the next NpcDialogue. keep doing that for every NpcDialogue you want to pass on by 1 NpcDialogue. (add || NpcDialogue == ###)

Read full topic

should it be NpcDialogueSend = True?
